questions.question: He is neither clever ................................ ambitious.
questions.description: We use the correlative conjunction neither/nor here.

questions.question: ............................... being physically challenged, he has great enthusiasm for life.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or an ing form.

questions.question: ..................................... working hard, we could not succeed.
questions.description: It should be despite or in spite of.

questions.question: The doctors tried their best .............................., they could not save her.
questions.description: However does not connect two clauses. It follows a full stop or a semicolon.

questions.question: ................................. you start behaving, you will be in trouble.
The cat must have been somewhere around ................................ I couldn't find her.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: .................................... he is educated, he lacks common sense.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas. Despite is not a conjunction.

questions.question: .................................. you had invested your money in real estate, you would have become richer today.
I don't know ................................. they will recognize me after all these years.
questions.description: We can use if or whether to introduce an indirect yes/no question.

questions.question: This is the town ..................................... he spent his childhood.
It has been several weeks, ................................. I heard anything from her.
.................................. cannot be cured must be endured.
